body.head: These hospitals
body.p:
These hospitals—so different from all others— these thousands and tens and twenties of thousands of American young men, badly wounded, operated on, pallid, with diarrhea, languishing, fevered, dying,with fever, diarreheapneumonia &c open a new world somehow to me, giving closer insights, new things, exploring deeper mines than any yet, showing our humanity, (I often put myself, in fancy, or try to place myself in the cot with typhoid, or under the knife,) tried by terrible, fearfulest tests, probed deepest, the living soul's, the body's tragedies, bursting the petty bonds of art. To these, what are your dramas and poems, even the oldest and tearfulest? Not the old Greek mighty ones, where man contends with fate nor Virgil showing Dante shown by Virgil on and on among the agonized and damned, approach these
things here

a part in. Nor soar so high with to me, as these. For here, not now and then, but with incredible and not at intervals, but almost always I
find see for myself

Why is put to flight with ignominy! as a stuffed scarecrow of the fields.
One feels to ask,s with new and now literal application, O death where is thy sting? O grave where is thy victory? Dr. In the Patent Office, just off from the bedside one night of a dying soldier, in
the a large
Ward having the worst cases from 2d Bull Runn, Antietam, and Fredericksburgh, the surgeon in charge, Dr. Stone, (Horatio Stone, the sculptor.) told me that of all who had died there for six months past, he had
not known or heard of one still to hear of the first one man or boy
who had met the approach of death with a single tremor or unmanly fear!
